questions.question: A market can be described as

choices.answer: location where goods/services are bought and sold with buyers/sellers
the demand for a product/service
buyers/sellers  agreeing on price & quantity
all of the above

questions.question: Who determines what the price of a product will be?

choices.answer: the seller
the buyer
the market
the government

questions.question: What is the criteria necessary for demand to exist?

choices.answer: There exists a want or a need
There is a want/need and you have the ability to buy it
The price for the product is good
None of the above

questions.question: Which of the following factors will shift the demand curve?

choices.answer: Price
A flash sale on a trendy item
Income
None of the above

questions.question: A increase in quantity demanded  is reflected by which of the following?

choices.answer: A shift in the curve to the right
A downward movement along the curve
An upward movement along the curve
A shift in the curve to the left

questions.question: What impact will high unemployment as a result of the Coronavirus pandemic have on the demand curve?

choices.answer: There is no effect on the curve
The demand curve will shift outwards
The demand curve will shift inwards
There is a movement along the curve

questions.question: What effect does a sale on a Wendy's crispy chicken have on the demand for their beef hamburger?

choices.answer: No effect on the demand for hamburger
The demand curve for beef hamburger will shift outwards
The demand curve will shift inwards
Upward movement along the demand curve

questions.question: Price of the new iPhone 12 is expected to go down in January.  What will that do to the demand curve?

choices.answer: Downward movement along the curve
Upward movement along the curve
Demand curve will shift outwards
Demand curve will shift inwards

questions.question: The number of auto makers making electric vehicles has increased significantly.  What effect will that have on supply?

choices.answer: Will shift supply to the left and increase price
Will shift supply to the left and reduce price
Will shift the supply to the right and increase price
Will shift the supply to the right and reduce price

questions.question: An increase in tariffs on Cdn lumber will have what effect on the supply of new homes in the US?

choices.answer: Will shift supply to the left and increase price
Will shift supply to the left and reduce price
Will shift the supply to the right and increase price
Will shift the supply to the right and reduce price

questions.question: Why does a supply curve rise from bottom left to top right?

choices.answer: Price increases, quantity supplied decreases
price increases, quantity supplied increases
inverse relationship between price and quantity supplied
direct relationship between price and quantity supplied
quantity supplied is equal to quantity demanded
market equals demand
market equals supply
none of the above
the quantity supplied exceeds the quantity demanded
the quantity demanded exceeds the quantity supplied
the price for a product increases
the price for a product decreases
quantity supplied exceeds quantity demanded
quantity demanded exceeds quantity supplied
price of a product decreases
price of product increases

questions.question: What happens to the market for fuel if fuel-efficient car sales rise?

choices.answer: Decrease in demand, decrease in  price
Increase in demand, decrease in price
Increase in demand, price stays the same
none of the above
